Ferrari Unveils Factory to Make Its First Electric Supercars

Italian manufacturer to present its first EV late next year

Factory is meant to boost flexibility, not production volume

Ferrari NV is inching closer to its first all-electric supercar, revealing a new factory in Italy where the brand will produce the next generation of its sought-after vehicles.

The site in Maranello, built over the past couple of years and shielded from public view, will make Ferrariâ€™s first EV from late 2025 alongside hybrid models and cars powered by combustion engines.
